38. The method of claim 31 wherein the step of answering a second telephone call occurs while said first call is in progress.

39. A method for providing a personal telecommunications service, said method comprising the steps of storing for a subscriber telephone number a plurality of caller identifiers including a first caller identifier and a specification of a first call treatment associated with the first caller identifier, answering a first telephone call directed to said subscriber telephone number, receiving a caller identifier previously stored for said telephone number during said call after said call has been answered, processing said call using a call treatment associated with the received caller identifier and stored for said subscriber telephone number by connecting said first telephone call with a device at a telephone network address defined by the call treatment associated with the received identifier, answering a second telephone call directed to said subscriber telephone number, processing said second telephone call using a second call treatment in the absence of receipt during said second call of said first caller identifier stored for said subscriber telephone number.

40. The method of claim 39 wherein said first and second call treatments each further include using one of a predetermined plurality of call handling modes, and wherein said method further comprises the step of prompting the originator of said second call to select one of a predetermined plurality of options.
41. The method of claim 39 wherein an identifier received while handling an incoming call may cause another identifier to be called as a subroutine.

42. The method of claim 39 wherein said telephone number is assigned to a controlling subscriber and said controlling subscriber controls selection of which caller identifiers are stored and controls selection of the specification of call treatments associated with caller identifiers.

43. The method of claim 39 wherein said subscriber telephone number is any ordinary telephone number normally accessible via a Public Switched Telephone Network, and a telephone call may be directed thereto without a need for a calling party to provide a special access code.
44. The method of claim 39 wherein the step of answering a second telephone call occurs while said first call is in progress.

45. An arrangement for providing a personal telecommunications service, said arrangement comprising means for storing, for a subscriber telephone number, a plurality of caller identifiers each associated with a specification defining a respective call treatment; means for answering a first telephone call directed to said subscriber telephone number; means for receiving a caller identifier, and receiving an incoming caller identifier during said first call after it has been answered;
and means for processing said first call using a call treatment which has been stored for said subscriber telephone number as associated with the received incoming caller identifier.

46. The arrangement of claim 45 wherein said means for processing processes an answered second telephone call directed to said subscriber telephone number using a second call treatment in the absence of receipt, during said second call after it has been answered, of a caller identifier which has been stored for said subscriber telephone number.
47. The arrangement of claim 46 wherein said received caller identifier is a predetermined number.

48. The arrangement of claim 46 wherein said first and second call treatments each include forwarding a call to a selected one of a predetermined plurality of destinations, said destinations including a default telephone number, a subscriber-administrable alternate telephone number, and a voice messaging facility.
49. The arrangement of claim 48 wherein said first call treatment includes providing service announcements to an originator of said call in a language.
50. The arrangement of claim 46 wherein charges associated with said second call are billed to a telephone number other than said particular subscriber telephone number.
51. The arrangement of claim 46 wherein each said call treatment further comprises using one of a predetermined plurality of call handling modes.
52. The arrangement of claim 51 comprising the further step of indicating to the originator of a particular call a destination that will be used in processing said particular call.
53. The arrangement of claim 51 wherein said call treatment includes the billing of a call to the originator of said call.

54. The arrangement of claim 51 further comprising means for indicating to an originator of a particular call a destination that will be used in processing that particular call and for extending to said originator an option to terminate said call.

55. The arrangement of claim 50 wherein said first call treatment comprises forwarding said first call to a voice messaging facility which provides a selected announcement message to an originator of said first call, said announcement being a first announcement if the caller identifier received during said call is said first caller identifier and being a second announcement otherwise.
56. The arrangement of claim 55 wherein said second announcement is a default announcement.

57. The arrangement of claim 46 wherein said first call treatment comprises forwarding said first call to at least a first predetermined telephone number and wherein said second call treatment comprises forwarding said second call to a voice messaging facility.

58. The arrangement of claim 46 wherein said second call treatment comprises entry into a service administration menu provided in response to receipt during said second call of a predetermined subscriber identifier.

59. The arrangement of claim 58 wherein said subscriber identifier and each caller identifier provided by callers are numbers, said subscriber identifier having a distinguishing characteristic from any caller identifier provided by callers.

60. The arrangement of claim 58 wherein said service administration menu includes a predetermined plurality of service functionalities each selectable by a caller associated with said predetermined subscriber identifier.

61. The arrangement of claim 60 wherein one of said plurality of administrable service functionalities includes extending said second call to a voice messaging service so that the associated caller may obtain messages priorly stored in said messaging service that are addressed to said associated caller.

62. The arrangement of claim 60 wherein one of said plurality of administrable service functionalities includes a meet-me service operative for allowing the caller to page said predetermined subscriber.
63. The arrangement of claim 60 wherein one of said plurality of administrable service functionalities includes extending said second call to an enhanced service.

64. The arrangement of claim 60 wherein one of said plurality of administrable service functionalities includes a first option to program a predetermined number of call forwarding telephone numbers associated with respective call treatments.

65. The arrangement of claim 64 wherein another one of said plurality of administrable service functionalities includes a second option to program caller identifiers and associate those identifiers with different ones of said respective call treatments including default call treatments.
66. The arrangement of claim 65 wherein said second option includes associating said respective call treatments with respective durations of time during which said treatments may be invoked.

67. The arrangement of claim 66 further comprising means for associating at least one of said caller identifiers with a series of call treatments and for processing a received call associated with said one caller identifier in accordance with successive call treatments in said series if the received call cannot be completed after being processed in accordance with preceding call treatments in said series.

68. The arrangement of claim 66 further comprising means for associating at least one of said associated caller identifiers with a series of call treatments and for processing a received call associated with said one caller identifier in accordance with successive ones of the call treatments in said series if the received call cannot be processed in accordance with preceding ones of the call treatments in said series.

69. The arrangement of claim 60 wherein one of said plurality of administrable service functionalities includes a first option of allowing the caller associated with said predetermined subscriber identifier to change associated caller identifiers and/or call treatments associated with those identifiers.
70. The method of claim 66 wherein said first option includes an option of associating said caller identifiers with respective names.
71. The arrangement of claim 47 wherein each said second call treatment further comprises using one of a predetermined plurality of call handling modes.

72. The arrangement of claim 71 comprising the further step of indicating to an originator of a particular call a destination that will be used in processing said particular call and/or a billing mode for that particular call.
73. The arrangement of claim 72 wherein said call treatment associated with the caller identifier received during said first call includes billing said first call to an originator of said first call.

74. The arrangement of claim 72 further comprising means for indicating to an originator of a particular call a destination that will be used in processing that particular call and/or a handling mode therefor.

75. The arrangement of claim 45 wherein said telephone number is assigned to a controlling subscriber and said controlling subscriber controls selection of which caller identifiers are stored and controls selection of the specification of call treatments associated with caller identifiers.

76. The arrangement of claim 45 wherein said subscriber telephone number is an ordinary telephone number representing a particular telephone network address including area code and seven-digit number, and a telephone call may be directed thereto by dialing the seven-digit number along with an international call identifier if needed, a national code if an international call, a long-distance identifier if needed, and the area code if needed.
